poem:
**In the Margins of History**

They rewrite with ink,  
on pages thin as whispers,  
where protests once surged  
like rivers untamed.  
Voices, echoes in stone,  
bend under new hands  
that cradle truths gently  
into their own.  
Yet in margins of silence,  
the past sharpens,  
etching the unquiet  
truths of the earth.

Mr Hain, I’m afraid, needs to return to his history books. Describing those radical and sometimes violent movements as “peaceful protest” domesticates". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
